choices.answer: When large numbers of visitors go to one place.
Over population of a country.
When a large family travels abroad.
Peak holiday times, usually in summer.

questions.question: Which is a positive effect/impact of Mass Tourism?

choices.answer: Price increase in local shops-tourists wealthier than locals
Most money goes out of the area to big companies, not locals
Greater demand for local food and crafts
Local traditions  kept alive-tourists like traditional shows

questions.question: Which is a negative impact of Mass Tourism?

choices.answer: Culture and traditions change as outsiders arrive.
Tourists learn new cultures and traditions.

questions.question: Why can it be a problem if a country relies heavily on tourism?

choices.answer: Tourists can be badly behaved upset people  living there.
If people stop coming then they'll have no source of income
Tourists bring lots of money in with them.

questions.question: How can the negative impacts of tourism be reduced?

choices.answer: Improve public transport-reduces congestion and pollution.
Improve advertising so more people go abroad.
Get rid of public transport to clear roads and congestion.
Make it more seasonal jobs available.

questions.question: How can holiday resorts ensure tourist keep visiting?

choices.answer: Offer new activities to attract people who don't usually go.
Dedicate a large area of land to tourists i.e farmland.
Make it cheaper to visit-lower entrance fees to attractions.

questions.question: Why is Kenya an important tourist destination?

choices.answer: Its culture-the Masai attract tourists who learn new customs
Its near Indian Ocean giving tourists tropical beach/waters.
Mount Kenya gives activities such as birdwatching /hiking.
Kenya borders the Antarctic  ocean creating a warm climate.

questions.question: What has the local government done to manage the impacts of tourism in Kenya?

choices.answer: Various eco resorts i.e Kigio Conservancy have been set up.
Various eco resorts i.e Kaegio Trust have been set up.

questions.question: What are the economic benefits of tourism for Kenya?

choices.answer: Provide jobs for locals
Provides 15% of Kenya's GDP
Provides for 21% of Kenya's economy.

questions.question: Kenya's 'big five' include: Rhino, Lion, Elephant, Leopard and what  other animal?

choices.answer: Jaguar
Buffalo
Giraffe
Tiger

questions.question: True or False: Walking or Horseback Tours are being promoted over Vehicle Safaris?

choices.answer: True
False
